title: NLP-Based EMG Training Course for Neurology Residents

context.prior_knowledge: Neuroanatomy and Basic Neurological Clinical Knowledge
context.additional_context: Conducted in a hands-on digital environment using peer learning (NPL) methods, structured with senior residents mentoring junior residents.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the technical procedures of EMG (Electromyography) examinations and the principles of interpreting results.
Learners enhance their ability to connect EMG results with pathologies through real clinical case analysis.
Learners acquire effective knowledge-sharing and feedback skills in a peer-learning environment.
Learners can analyze individual learning gaps and develop compensatory plans through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
